title: How to Make Sassafras Mead

steps.headline: Mix  the boiling water gradually with the sugar, molasses and tartaric acid.
Stir well.
steps.description: When cool, strain it into a large jug or pan.

steps.headline: Transfer the mixture to clean bottles.
steps.description: It will fill about half a dozen bottles.

steps.headline: Cork or seal each bottle tightly and keep in a cool place.
steps.description: It will be fit for use next day.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: To prepare a glass of sassafras mead for drinking, put a large tablespoonful of the mead into half a tumbler full of ice-water, stir into it a half teaspoonful of the soda and it will immediately foam up to the top.

text: Mix  the boiling water gradually with the sugar, molasses and tartaric acid.  Stir well. When cool, strain it into a large jug or pan. Mix in the sassafras essence.  Transfer the mixture to clean bottles. It will fill about half a dozen bottles. Cork or seal each bottle tightly and keep in a cool place. It will be fit for use next day. Serve. To prepare a glass of sassafras mead for drinking, put a large tablespoonful of the mead into half a tumbler full of ice-water, stir into it a half teaspoonful of the soda and it will immediately foam up to the top.
